description: A TabulatedFileTimeseries represents time-varying data of a specific data type for a single contiguous time interval. The data is provided in an external file referenced in the TabulatedFileTimeseries. The file contains table structured data using an appropriate file format such as comma-separated values (CSV), Microsoft Excel (XLSX) or Google Spreadsheet. The timestamps and the values are given in specific columns of the table. Each row represents a single time-value-pair. A subset of rows can be selected using the idColumn and idValue attributes.

properties.name: fileLocation
properties.description: Specifies the URI that points to the external timeseries file.

properties.name: fileType
properties.description: Specifies the format used to represent the timeseries data.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: Specifies the MIME type of the external timeseries file.

properties.name: valueType
properties.description: Indicates the specific type of the timeseries data.

properties.name: numberOfHeaderLines
properties.description: Indicates the number of lines at the beginning of the tabulated file that represent headers.

properties.name: fieldSeparator
properties.description: Indicates which symbol is used to separate the individual values in the tabulated file.

properties.name: decimalSymbol
properties.description: Indicates which symbol is used to separate the integer part from the fractional part of a decimal number.

properties.name: idColumnNo
properties.description: Specifies the number of the column that stores the identifier of the time-value-pair.

properties.name: idColumnName
properties.description: Specifies the name of the column that stores the identifier of the time-value-pair.

properties.name: idValue
properties.description: Specifies the value of the identifier for which the time-value-pairs are to be selected.

properties.name: timeColumnNo
properties.description: Specifies the number of the column that stores the timestamp of the time-value-pair.

properties.name: timeColumnName
properties.description: Specifies the name of the column that stores the timestamp of the time-value-pair.

properties.name: valueColumnNo
properties.description: Specifies the number of the column that stores the value of the time-value-pair.

properties.name: valueColumnName
properties.description: Specifies the name of the column that stores the value of the time-value-pair.
